source.name: Cross-Chain Governance in DAOs
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios best demonstrates cross-chain governance in a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO)?

answers.answer: A vote on Ethereum initiates protocol changes on another blockchain
A DAO conducts all its voting processes exclusively on the Ethereum network
Members of a DAO use multiple wallets to participate in governance
A DAO stores its treasury funds across different blockchains
A DAO uses off-chain voting to make decisions about on-chain actions

source.guidance: The correct answer is "A vote on Ethereum initiates protocol changes on another blockchain." This scenario demonstrates cross-chain governance as it involves a decision made on one blockchain (Ethereum) directly affecting operations on a different blockchain. This exemplifies true interoperability in DAO governance across multiple chains. The other options do not necessarily involve cross-chain interactions: conducting voting on a single network, using multiple wallets, storing funds across chains, or using off-chain voting can all occur without true cross-chain governance implementation. This question tests the student's understanding of how DAOs can leverage blockchain interoperability to extend their governance capabilities across different networks.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify practical applications of cross-chain governance in DAOs
